content.description:
A fine little spot on the outskirts of town, the Bealby Boulders offer a very unique style of rock and something a little different than the other areas in the West Kootenays. The rock is made up of a very compact form of Granite with imbedded quartz? type crystals and bulletproof (sloper) features that makes for some very interesting climbing. Although there aren’t a lot of problems, the quality and its proximity to Nelson make it a fine choice for a quick before or after work session but could also keep you busy for a day or two! Lots of shade opportunities and morning sun make it a nice choice for summer mornings when the forest is nice and cool. Climbers have been dabbing on a few of the boulders over the years judging by bits of chalk evidence but a recent surge in development has sprouted up many new fantastic problems that certainly make this place worth checking out! Oh, and did I mention, the infamous ‘Red Sands’ beach is located just below the bouldering area that makes for a perfect post climb dip. Enjoy…
